Class Triangle

java.lang.Object
AbstractShape
Triangle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Shape>, Shape
public class Triangle extends AbstractShape
This class represents a triangle defined by three points in 2D space. It extends the AbstractShape class and provides methods to calculate the area and perimeter of the triangle. Additionally, it allows resizing the triangle while maintaining its shape based on a scaling factor. The triangle is defined by three vertices: the reference point (the first vertex) and two additional points. The class ensures that all three points are unique; if not, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown during construction.

  • Constructor Details

    • Triangle

      public Triangle(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double x3, double y3)
      Constructs a triangle with the specified vertices.
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x-coordinate of the first vertex
      y1 - the y-coordinate of the first vertex
      x2 - the x-coordinate of the second vertex
      y2 - the y-coordinate of the second vertex
      x3 - the x-coordinate of the third vertex
      y3 - the y-coordinate of the third vertex
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any two vertices are the same

  • Method Details

    • area

      public double area()
      Calculates the area of the triangle using the formula: 
       area = |(x1 * (y2 - y3) + x2 * (y3 - y1) + x3 * (y1 - y2)) / 2.0|
      Returns:
      the area of the triangle

    • perimeter

      public double perimeter()
      Calculates the perimeter of the triangle by summing the lengths of all its sides.
      Returns:
      the perimeter of the triangle

    • resize

      public Shape resize(double factor)
      Resizes the triangle by a given scaling factor. The size of the triangle is modified while maintaining its shape.
      Parameters:
      factor - the scaling factor; must be greater than zero
      Returns:
      a new Triangle instance with the resized dimensions
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the resize factor is less than or equal to zero

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the triangle, displaying the coordinates of its vertices.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string formatted as "Triangle with points: (x1, y1), (x2, y2), (x3, y3)"
